newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia-American crew on Mir relax after accident.
newsitem.headline: Russia-American crew on Mir relax after accident.

text.p: Two Russians and an American astronaut were relaxing on the space station Mir on Saturday, three days after a collision which damaged their power supply, mission control said.
"The cosmonauts said the night was okay and that they slept well," a spokeswoman at Korolyov mission control, near Moscow, told reporters after the first radio conversation of the day with the crew.

Saturday was designated a rest day. Russian officials said on Friday the situation had stabilised after the collision during a docking manoeuvre on Wednesday in which a cargo craft holed a scientific module attached to Mir.
Repair work is expected to start when new equipment arrives in about 10 days.

Commander Vasily Tsibliyev, 43, flight engineer Alexander Lazutkin, 39, and American physicist Michael Foale, 40, sounded calm in conversations with mission control on Friday but were showing signs of fatigue.
Wednesday's collision left the orbital outpost with only half its usual supply of power and robbed it of its most efficient batteries, used when the station is in darkness.
